channel.title: Introduction :: K-State CIS 400 Textbook
channel.description: Throughout the earlier chapters, we’ve focused on the theoretical aspects of Object-Orientation, and discussed how those are embodied in the C# language. Before we close this section though, it would be a good idea to recognize that C# is not just an object-oriented language, but actually draws upon many ideas and syntax approaches that are not very object-oriented at all! In this chapter, we’ll examine many aspects of C# that fall outside of the object-oriented mold.
